citations.title: Pages: typically 9 pages main text; references unlimited; appendix in supplementary; use official LaTeX style (confirm on CFP)
Anonymization: double-blind; no self-identifying links during review
Reproducibility: NeurIPS Paper Checklist required
Pages: typically 9 pages main text; references unlimited; official LaTeX style —  and example paper https://media.icml.cc/Conferences/ICML2025/Styles/example_paper.pdf
Pages: typically 9 pages main text; references unlimited; official LaTeX style — https://icml.cc/Conferences/2025/AuthorInstructions and example paper

Anonymization: double-blind on OpenReview
Pages: 8 pages main text; references unlimited; separate supplementary
Anonymization: double-blind; no identifying links during review
Pages: long = 8 pages, short = 4 pages; references unlimited; appendices after references
Anonymization: double-blind (ARR policy)
Reproducibility: Responsible NLP Research Checklist is required as an appendix
Pages: usually long = 8, short = 4; references unlimited
Anonymization: double-blind
Pages: different from CVPR (check official policies); usually separate supplementary
Pages: strict page limits specified in Author Kit; separate supplementary policy
Anonymization: double-blind — see anonymous formatting notes
Reproducibility: AAAI-25 reproducibility checklist
Code/data: encouraged; check ethics and reproducibility requirements
Pages: main track page limits defined in CFP; references unlimited; supplementary allowed
Code/data: encouraged; follow data-use/ethics guidance
Pages: research track page limits specified in CFP
Reproducibility/artifacts: ACM Artifact Badging program offered (optional but valuable) —  and ACM policy https://www.acm.org/publications/policies/artifact-review-and-badging-current
Reproducibility/artifacts: ACM Artifact Badging program offered (optional but valuable) — https://kdd2025.kdd.org/call-for-artifact-badging/ and ACM policy
